Package <Unnamed>

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    BoardInterface
    This interface is used to define how an instance of a Board can be communicated with.
    GameManagerInterface
    GameManagerInterface provides an abstract interface to a GameManager Class that should be implemented.
    MoveInterface
    Represents a move a player wishes to make DO NOT CHANGE THIS FILE
    PlayerInterface
    This interface represents a player within the game of Hex and the methods that a player should make DO NOT CHANGE THIS FILE
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Board
    An implementation of a hex board, storing the positions as a 2-dimensional array of Piece values Included win-checking algorithm is implemented as depth-first search designed to be fast in the most common circumstances at the expense of being slower in unusual circumstances.
    ComputerPlayer_xvhn44
    An AI player implementation of the PlayerInterface interface which implements four AI types: Mirror If player colour is blue, and the board size satisfies y = x + 1, Mirror the opponent as seen here: http://mathworld.wolfram.com/GameofHex.html Middle If it is the first move, go for the middle hex Djikstra Look at every possible move up to two layers deep, evaluating the value of the board using djikstra's algorithm.
    Coordinate
    An immutable class storing x and y integers to allow for easier passing of pair values.
    DjikstraRunnable
    A runnable which calculates the best moves that can be made and stores them, ready to provide back to the ComputerPlayer that created the object.
    Edge
    An Edge connects two Nodes.
    GameManager
    GameManager defines how the game is set up and calls the methods needed for the game to be played.
    Graph
    A graph stores nodes such that the distance from a start to end node can be calculated.
    GUIBoard
    GameManager defines how the game is set up and calls the methods needed for the game to be played.
    GUIFrame  
    GUIPanel
    Created by Steven on 23/04/2016.
    Hex
    Created by Steven on 23/04/2016.
    HumanPlayer
    A human player that takes user input and makes the move.
    Main
    Created by Steven on 15/03/2016.
    MainMenu
    Create the main menu, and initialise games based on its settings
    MCTSRunnable
    The MCTSRunnable is an object which runs the MCTS code in a thread to allow for multithreading of the AI.
    Move
    Represents a move a player wishes to make
    Node
    Created by Steven on 13/04/2016.
    PotentialMove
    Stores a potential move for the Djikstra AI - storing first, and second moves, and the distances for each player after both moves have been made.
    QualityPanel
    Just sets antialiasing to be used on the panel and keeps everything else to be the same - so it doesn't have to be set each and every time.
    Utility
    Stores static utilities.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    AIType
    The AI algorithm that should be used
    EdgeType
    The type of an edge
    GameState
    Enumeration class GameState - Defining for the end of the game what the final state is - WON, LOST, INCOMPLETE DO NOT CHANGE THIS FILE
    NodeType
    PLAYER nodes belong to the player (i.e.
    Piece
    Enumeration class Piece - defines the three different states of a Piece or position on the board these can be: RED - a red piece BLUE - a blue piece UNSET - no piece specified yet DO NOT CHANGE THIS FILE
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    BoardAlreadySizedException
    Exception to indicate that someone is trying to resize a board which is aready sized.
    ColourAlreadySetException
    Exception to indicate that a color has already been allocated to a player DO NOT CHANGE THIS FILE
    InvalidBoardSizeException
    Exception to indicate that the board size selection is invalid DO NOT CHANGE THIS FILE
    InvalidColourException
    Exception to indicate that the selected colour is invalid in this context.
    InvalidPositionException
    Exception to indicate that the position specified is invalid - e.g.
    NoBoardDefinedException
    Exception to indicate that someone is trying to resize a board which is aready sized.
    NodeWeightNotSetException
    Created by Steven on 18/04/2016.
    NoValidMovesException
    Exception to indicate that it is not possible to make a move.
    PositionAlreadyTakenException
    Exception to indicate that a cell where someone is trying to place a piece is already occupied DO NOT CHANGE THIS FILE
